review: This is a great add-on to your HDTV. It plugs into an available HDMI port on your TV and gets its power from a USB port on your TV or from a wall outlet. With specific Chromecast-compatible smartphone apps, you can control the content that is played through the Chromecast onto your TV. For example, if you want to watch a movie from Netflix on your TV, you open up the Netflix app on your phone, press the button within that app that makes it connect to the Chromecast, choose a movie, and hit play. The movie will then begin to play onto your TV (as opposed to playing on your phone). During this time you can still use your phone to do other tasks, or just set it aside while you watch your media. There are a handful of Chromecast-compatible apps that are useful. Another neat feature is the ability to mirror your Android smartphone screen to your TV. I have an Android phone [HTC One (M7)] and using the Chromecast app, I can mirror my phone display onto the TV. This is great when you want to share pictures or videos with a room full of people. For such an inexpensive device, I highly recommend it.
